description: I don't know what this other person's issue is. But it works perfectly for me!

App is crashing at 50% app loading process. I think It may be connected with detecting CommanderPro or something.
When I've installed it opened once and last time. Reinstalling does not help :(
Works flawlessly with my NZXT Kraken X73, NZXT RGB & Fan controller, and it controls all the fans connected my MSI motherboard!

I followed this official guide: https://gitlab.com/coolero/coolero#hwmon-support (I am using the Flatpak version)
Didn't help, I installed lm_sensors, did the other steps in the guide but without any luck. I restarted the app and my pc, but nothing helped. Maybe the flatpak can't access some important paths? I hope the dev is able to fix this, I will change my review when new update arrives
summary: Doesn't find any fans. Only finds temperature for CPU and GPU

description: Been using it in Ubuntu 20.04 for a couple of days now without issues
Only shows CPU temperature and usage which is essentially useless. Does not show anything about the fans. This same problem was reported by other users.
It's very friendly for someone like me who comes from windows 10 and don't know how to work with terminal

works great , very usefull having a fanless tesla gpu, since with this app I can easily configure one of my system fan to blow accordingly to the tesla temperature... something that otherwise would require manual scripting. I'm just annoyed by the fact that everytime I start my machine and start the app I would have to type the password
Great app, waiting for more displays options support for Kraken Z73
summary: Great app, waiting for more displays options support for Kraken Z73

description:
It works out of the box beautifully with Arch Linux!
I did not run into any issues for the past few weeks using it.
Even supports GIFs and Pictures now!
(Using NZXT Kraken z73)

Finally something that works with Commander Core. Only 1 issue, my rgb's won't stop blinking. I don't care if they are even light up but they won't stop blink. Anyone have any ideas other than unplugging them? I tried unplugging them but since the AIO is directly connected to the MB it will still blink.
